.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Matcher extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Util.Regex.IMatchResult, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The result of applying a Pattern to a given input.

remarks.para: The result of applying a Pattern to a given input. See for example uses.

MemberSignature.Value: public Java.Util.Regex.Matcher AppendReplacement (Java.Lang.StringBuffer buffer, string replacement);
.method public hidebysig instance class Java.Util.Regex.Matcher AppendReplacement(class Java.Lang.StringBuffer buffer, string replacement) cil managed

Docs.summary: Appends a literal part of the input plus a replacement for the current match to a given .

remarks.para: Appends a literal part of the input plus a replacement for the current match to a given . The literal part is exactly the part of the input between the previous match and the current match. The method can be used in conjunction with and to walk through the input and replace all occurrences of the Pattern with something else.

Docs.exception: if no successful match has been made.

Docs.summary: Appends the (unmatched) remainder of the input to the given .

remarks.para: Appends the (unmatched) remainder of the input to the given . The method can be used in conjunction with and to walk through the input and replace all matches of the Pattern with something else.

Docs.exception: if no successful match has been made.

Docs.summary: Returns the index of the first character following the text that matched the whole regular expression.

remarks.para: Returns the index of the first character following the text that matched the whole regular expression.

Docs.exception: if no successful match has been made.

Docs.param: the group, ranging from 0 to groupCount() - 1, with 0 representing the whole pattern.
Docs.summary: Returns the index of the first character following the text that matched a given group.

remarks.para: Returns the index of the first character following the text that matched a given group. See for an explanation of group indexes.

Docs.exception: if no successful match has been made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Find() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves to the next occurrence of the pattern in the input.

remarks.para: Moves to the next occurrence of the pattern in the input. If a previous match was successful, the method continues the search from the first character following that match in the input. Otherwise it searches either from the region start (if one has been set), or from position 0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Find(int32 start) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if there is another match in the input, starting from the given position.

remarks.para: Returns true if there is another match in the input, starting from the given position. The region is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string Group() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the text that matched the whole regular expression.

remarks.para: Returns the text that matched the whole regular expression.

Docs.exception: if no successful match has been made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string Group(int32 group) cil managed

Docs.param: the group, ranging from 0 to groupCount() - 1, with 0 representing the whole pattern.
Docs.summary: Returns the text that matched a given group of the regular expression.

remarks.para: Returns the text that matched a given group of the regular expression.

Explicit capturing groups in the pattern are numbered left to right in order of their opening parenthesis, starting at 1. The special group 0 represents the entire match (as if the entire pattern is surrounded by an implicit capturing group). For example, "a((b)c)" matching "abc" would give the following groups:
0 "abc" 1 "bc" 2 "b"

An optional capturing group that failed to match as part of an overall successful match (for example, "a(b)?c" matching "ac") returns null. A capturing group that matched the empty string (for example, "a(b?)c" matching "ac") returns the empty string.

Docs.exception: if no successful match has been made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string Group(string p0) cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GroupCount() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the number of groups in the results, which is always equal to the number of groups in the original regular expression.

remarks.para: Returns the number of groups in the results, which is always equal to the number of groups in the original regular expression.

Docs.summary: Returns true if this matcher has anchoring bounds enabled.

remarks.para: Returns true if this matcher has anchoring bounds enabled. When anchoring bounds are enabled, the start and end of the input match the '^' and '$' meta-characters, otherwise not. Anchoring bounds are enabled by default.

Docs.summary: Returns true if this matcher has transparent bounds enabled.

remarks.para: Returns true if this matcher has transparent bounds enabled. When transparent bounds are enabled, the parts of the input outside the region are subject to lookahead and lookbehind, otherwise they are not. Transparent bounds are disabled by default.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool HitEnd() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if the most recent matching operation attempted to access additional text beyond the available input, meaning that additional input could change the results of the match.

remarks.para: Returns true if the most recent matching operation attempted to access additional text beyond the available input, meaning that additional input could change the results of the match.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool LookingAt() cil managed

Docs.summary: Tries to match the , starting from the beginning of the region (or the beginning of the input, if no region has been set).

remarks.para: Tries to match the , starting from the beginning of the region (or the beginning of the input, if no region has been set). Doesn't require the Pattern to match against the whole region.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Matches() cil managed

Docs.summary: Tries to match the against the entire region (or the entire input, if no region has been set).

remarks.para: Tries to match the against the entire region (or the entire input, if no region has been set).

Docs.summary: Returns the instance used inside this matcher.

remarks.para: Returns the instance used inside this matcher.

Docs.summary: Returns a replacement string for the given one that has all backslashes and dollar signs escaped.

Docs.param: the first character of the region.
the first character after the end of the region.
Docs.summary: Resets this matcher and sets a region.

remarks.para: Resets this matcher and sets a region. Only characters inside the region are considered for a match.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RequireEnd() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if the most recent match succeeded and additional input could cause it to fail.

remarks.para: Returns true if the most recent match succeeded and additional input could cause it to fail. If this method returns false and a match was found, then more input might change the match but the match won't be lost. If a match was not found, then requireEnd has no meaning.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Util.Regex.Matcher Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Resets the Matcher.

remarks.para: Resets the Matcher. This results in the region being set to the whole input. Results of a previous find get lost. The next attempt to find an occurrence of the in the string will start at the beginning of the input.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Util.Regex.Matcher Reset(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence input) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides a new input and resets the Matcher.

remarks.para: Provides a new input and resets the Matcher. This results in the region being set to the whole input. Results of a previous find get lost. The next attempt to find an occurrence of the in the string will start at the beginning of the input.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Util.Regex.Matcher Reset(string input) cil managed

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Util.Regex.IMatchResult ToMatchResult() cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the current match into a separate instance that is independent from this matcher.

remarks.para: Converts the current match into a separate instance that is independent from this matcher. The new object is unaffected when the state of this matcher changes.

Docs.exception: if no successful match has been made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Util.Regex.Matcher UseAnchoringBounds(bool value) cil managed

Docs.param: the new value for anchoring bounds.
Docs.summary: Determines whether this matcher has anchoring bounds enabled or not.

remarks.para: Determines whether this matcher has anchoring bounds enabled or not. When anchoring bounds are enabled, the start and end of the input match the '^' and '$' meta-characters, otherwise not. Anchoring bounds are enabled by default.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Util.Regex.Matcher UsePattern(class Java.Util.Regex.Pattern pattern) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets a new pattern for the Matcher.

remarks.para: Sets a new pattern for the Matcher. Results of a previous find get lost. The next attempt to find an occurrence of the in the string will start at the beginning of the input.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Util.Regex.Matcher UseTransparentBounds(bool value) cil managed

Docs.param: the new value for transparent bounds.
Docs.summary: Determines whether this matcher has transparent bounds enabled or not.

remarks.para: Determines whether this matcher has transparent bounds enabled or not. When transparent bounds are enabled, the parts of the input outside the region are subject to lookahead and lookbehind, otherwise they are not. Transparent bounds are disabled by default.
